abstract: Microsoft said it had agreed to acquire MultiMap, an online map service based in London, in an attempt to compete more effectively with the search services of Google.
snippet: Microsoft said it had agreed to acquire MultiMap, an online map service based in London, in an attempt to compete more effectively with the search services of Google.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft said it had agreed to acquire MultiMap, an online map service based in London, in an attempt to compete more effectively with the search services of Google and to collect more revenue from online and mobile advertising. The MultiMap Web site aids consumers in finding elusive addresses throughout Europe and the United States and in much of the rest of the world. It also offers services for business customers, allowing them to include maps on their Web sites. The acquisition, for an undisclosed amount, is part of a race by Microsoft and its competitors online to further develop their digital mapping abilities.

headline.main: In Its Race Against Google, Microsoft Buys MultiMap
